intro: Linaria filifolia var. welwitschiana, commonly known as the Welwitsch's hairvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves and delicate, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological traits. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens for its ornamental value.
